pkgmetadata.longdescription: Metric Reporting Python Package for CloudML Hypertune===================================================== Helper Functions for CloudML Engine Hypertune Services... _Google CloudML Engine Hyperparameter Tuning Service: https://cloud.google.com/ml-engine/docs/tensorflow/hyperparameter-tuning-overview|pypi| |versions|Prerequisites-------------- Google CloudML Engine `Overview <https://cloud.google.com/ml-engine/>`__.- Google CloudML Engine `Hyperparameter Tuning Overview <https://cloud.google.com/ml-engine/docs/tensorflow/hyperparameter-tuning-overview>`__.Installation------------Install via `pip <https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pip>`__::: pip install cloudml-hypertuneUsage-----.. code:: python import hypertune hpt = hypertune.HyperTune() hpt.report_hyperparameter_tuning_metric( hyperparameter_metric_tag='my_metric_tag', metric_value=0.987, global_step=1000)By default, the metric entries will be stored to ``/tmp/hypertune/outout.metric`` in json format::: {"global_step": "1000", "my_metric_tag": "0.987", "timestamp": 1525851440.123456, "trial": "0"}Licensing---------- Apache 2.0.. |pypi| image:: https://img.shields.io/pypi/v/cloudml-hypertune.svg :target: https://pypi.org/project/cloudml-hypertune/.. |versions| image:: https://img.shields.io/pypi/pyversions/cloudml-hypertune.svg :target: https://pypi.org/project/cloudml-hypertune/
